etymologies: early 17th century: from Virginia Algonquian opassom, from op ‘white’ + assom ‘dog’

definitions: an American marsupial which has a naked prehensile tail and hind feet with an opposable thumb.

notes.text: Family Didelphidae: several genera and numerous species, in particular the cat-sized common opossum (Didelphis marsupialis) of North, Central, and South America, which in North America was formerly known as the Virginia opossum and was considered a distinct species (D. virginiana)

shortDefinitions: American marsupial with naked prehensile tail
